titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Norman Malcolm, 15. 1. 1946
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original an der Trinity College Library; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Malcolm Memoir, S. 102; WiC, S. 393).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Your parcel containing cocoa & peaches arrived today. Thanks ever so much. It was lovely to get it. And is the cocoa good!! â€’ I've had almost a month in Swansea & I haven't done a stroke of work. I wish all your food for my body & mind could go to a better person. My lectures begin in 3 days. I'll talk a lot of rubbish. It would be nice if you could come to Cambridge for an academic year before I resign my job! It might be a good thing, & a good conclusion for my dubious professorial career.
Thanks again! & let me hear how you're getting on.
